repnme.cdata!: Iran - Urban Upgrading and Housing Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Urban Upgrading and
            Housing Reform Project for Iran were as follows: outcomes
            were unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was unsatisfactory, and the
            borrower performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: in project design there is a need
            to be sensitive to the institutional capacity of the
            country. If it lies on the lower end of the spectrum,
            complex or ambitious project design will not be feasible
            within that context as the learning curve maybe too steep.
            Systems in place are not effective if not exercised,
            especially for problematic projects in the portfolio. The
            project would have done better if there had been fewer
            cities with suitable measurement mechanisms which informed
            on the progress of the pilots and allowed for adjustments
            accordingly. It is important to assess the need to
            restructure the project earlier rather than later. If the
            extenuating circumstances of the project justify a full or
            partial restructuring, or a loan amount cancellation,
            reducing or omitting the scope of component/sub-component,
            action should be pursued effectively by the project team in
            a timely manner. It is important that the Bank understands
            and serves the client's needs when there has been
            little previous interaction by preparing upfront capacity
            building on Bank's processes and procedures. The
            project faced major difficulties and delays in salary
            payments to its staff as they were financed through the Government.

docna.cdata!: Iran - Urban Upgrading and Housing Reform Project

repnme.cdata!: Iran - Urban Upgrading and Housing Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall purpose of the proposed Iran
            Urban Upgrading and Housing Reform Project (UUHRP) is to
            facilitate the transition to a market-led housing sector in
            Iran, while improving current living conditions for low, and
            moderate income households. To achieve the above, a three
            phase Adaptable Program Loan was prepared and is spread over
            a period of twelve years. The key development objectives of
            this project (APL1) are to (i) improve the living conditions
            in under-serviced neighborhoods in up to five provincial
            capital cities and; (ii) prepare the systems, capacity, and
            regulatory foundation and initiate market based housing
            sector reforms. The Project objectives will be achieved
            through three main components: (i) urban upgrading and
            community enabling programs in up to 5 selected cities; (ii)
            technical assistance for housing sector reforms; and, (iii)
            technical assistance and capacity building for project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Iran - Low Income Housing Project :
            resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Low Income Housing Project will
            support the Government' s effort to narrow the living
            conditions' gap between the formal, and informal
            settlements in capital cities in Iran, and, improve the
            performance of the housing sector, through a long-term
            program of investment, and capacity building.
            Notwithstanding the development benefits for the long run,
            project implementation will entail displacement, and
            resettlement of local people, thus this resettlement action
            plan (RAP) presents the policy framework regarding
            compensation to be available for project affected people
            (PAP). Current laws are not clear in Iran, on indemnities
            for damages resulting from possession of lands, and
            properties, or associated rights, which makes the process of
            relocation difficult. To this end, the Bank's directive
            on involuntary resettlement, in line with preferences of the
            Constitution and the National Document on Enabling and
            Regularizing Unauthorized Settlement, forms the basis for
            this policy framework which will govern implementation of
            any resettlement activity under the project. Surveys will
            determine socioeconomic specifications, losses incurred,
            based on public consultations for formulate the appropriate
            compensation, ensuring living standards improve, or are at
            least restored. Resettlement compensation specifies the
            following: parcels of land will be compensated by exchanging
            to another locality, in accordance with agreed conditions,
            including infrastructure such as water, power, drainage, an
            urban and social services nearby; likewise, residential and
            business facilities will be exchanged to another locality,
            same as above; construction materials will be supplied, and
            technical assistance provided during construction.
            Monitoring methods shall ensure resettlement activities, and
            compensation comply with this framework, and, grievance
            mechanisms will be in place should conflict arise.

docna.cdata!:
Iran - Low Income Housing Project :
            resettlement action plan

repnme.cdata!:
Iran - Low Income Housing Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Low Income Housing Project will
            support the Government's effort to narrow the living
            conditions' gap between the formal, and informal
            settlements in capital cities in Iran, and, improve the
            performance of the housing sector, through a long-term
            program of investment, and capacity building. However, and
            though in the long-run the project will provide
            environmental benefits, during construction some subprojects
            may potentially have adverse environmental impacts. To this
            end, an environmental screening will be undertaken at the
            early stages of implementation, to identify adversity, and
            propose mitigation measures as agreed in the environmental
            management plans. Roads rehabilitation works will
            potentially cause clogging of natural drainage channels, and
            disturb storm water drainage; it is thus proposed to
            maintain ditches, and provide drainage facilities, to be the
            responsibility of contractors, and municipalities,
            respectively. Likewise, it will be the contractor's
            responsibility to appropriately dispose of construction
            wastes, and implement dust control measures, such as water
            spraying construction surfaces, and dirt roads, while it
            shall be the municipalities responsibility to inform, and
            coordinate with the appropriate government agency, should
            unknown archaeological finds occur. To minimize cross
            contamination of sewage and water lines due to pressure
            differentials, and leaks, as well as possible water
            reductions during construction of the water supply and
            wastewater networks, the Water and Wastewater Company should
            coordinate with each agency, and review the area's
            water balance. Municipalities, and the community shall be
            responsible during schools construction, to avoid
            encroachment following an adequate sites location, that
            ensures compliance with urban planning, and appropriate
            accessible roads, and basic infrastructure. Sites prone to
            flooding, and earthquakes, should be avoided as possible,
            otherwise appropriate engineering design measures, and
            seismic resistance should be ensured. The provision of
            adequate water quantity and quality should be ensured, and
            priority should be given to the installation of toilets,
            appropriate sanitation (cesspools), and disposal of solid wastes.

docna.cdata!:
Iran - Low Income Housing Project :
            environmental assessment

            : environmental assessment
